page.title: 20The Wheelbarrow Races
page.content: The Wheelbarrow Races began in 1953 but were discontinued in 1960 due to a lack of competitors.In 1968 interest was revived and popularity of the races sustained.The main event, The Men's Race covers a distance of nearly 2 miles taking the participants to the neighbouring village of Micklebring, where at the Plough Inn, the half-way mark, the competitors drink a 1/2 pint of beer. There are races for children of all ages, over a scaled down course. Trophies are awarded to the winners and each entrant receives a small financial reward. The whole village celebrates this event and there are side shows and a Grand Raffle. The village is proud of the Wheelbarrow Races and hope tradition will long continue.
